content.raw:
Small update: I'm testing this in a pure dartsim app, and I've confirmed that `MeshShape` + `PlaneShape` collisions are getting missed by the Bullet collision detector (which is the collision detector we're currently using by default in `ign-physics`).

Strangely, primitive shapes have no problem colliding with planes for the Bullet collision detector (I've tested with box, sphere, and cylinder primitives colliding with a plane).

Even stranger, the mesh has no problem colliding with the primitive shapes (tested against box, sphere, and cylinder).

This makes me suspect that Bullet itself might not currently support collisions between meshes and planes. I'll see if I can dig up some bullet documentation on this; if not, I'll see about using pybullet to set up a simple test in pure Bullet to get dartsim out of the loop and rule out the dartsim wrapper as a possible cause.
